forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 56. West southwest wind around 10 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.shortForecast: Partly Sunny then Slight Chance Drizzle
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle after 5pm. Partly sunny, with a high near 63. West southwest wind 10 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph.

weather_report:
As the dawn hours embrace Downtown San Francisco, a gentle veil of fog lingers just out of sight, an intangible reminder of the city’s unique embrace of marine layers. With a cool low of around fifty-six degrees, the atmosphere feels crisp, accented by a reassuring west southwest breeze that carries the whispers of the ocean. This morning's cloud cover drapes the urban landscape, offering a soft, muted light perfect for those seeking a quiet moment in the day, perhaps over a cup of coffee in one of the many charming cafes scattered along the streets.

Looking ahead to the afternoon, a salute of partial sunshine will break through the clouds, warming the city to a temperate sixty-three degrees. As the day stretches onward, the air will carry a hint of potential drizzle, teasing the palates of those out and about. It’s a day to dress in layers; a light jacket will suffice for the morning chill, while a comfortable sweater or long-sleeve top will keep you cozy during the transition from cloud to sun.

Given the gentle ebb and flow of the weather, a stroll through the vibrant streets or perhaps a visit to a local bookstore seems fitting. Pause to peruse the pages of your next literary adventure or explore the artistically rich neighborhoods, where inspiration waits at every corner. The day promises a blend of serenity and discovery, perfect for embracing the little moments that San Francisco uniquely offers before the day bids adieu to the lacework of fog.
